comment: Dr. Hayes is an amazing professor. He's very understanding and clearly wanted us to succeed. Tests were very similar to the material we saw in lectures, and he usually gave us hints on what to study beforehand. There were in class activities (basically a guaranteed 100), weekly homework, and 5 tests with a retake opportunity.

He was amazing, honestly the most chill professor ive had and accommodating. The material can be challenging, pay attention during lectures. Attendance is not mandatory but go to class there will be in class exercises that contribute to your grade,

I'm very glad I took Dr. Hayes for genetics lecture. There's homework in mastering each week, in class assignments about once a week, and 5 exams. No final and you can retake whichever exam you did the worst on. Studying for the exams is neccessary but he provides everything you need to know, especially the in class assignments.

He's picky on the lab notebook. Lectures for the first 10 min of class then expects you to know how to do the lab for the day. He's easy if you take the class seriously. Has a midterm that counts as the final but can retake. 1 group project at the end.

I took him for genetics lecture and his tests were hard even knowing what to study with the blue text on his powerpoints. He let us retake the test we did the worst on at the end of the semester, but he doesn't really curve. I went to his office hours after every test. A passing grade is very acheiveable, just be willing to put in a lot of work.

Professor Hayes makes genetics, which is supposed to be a difficult class, very manageable.  He really wants you to succeed and is very helpful in office hours.  The exams are hard but he makes them way easier by having a review the day before the exam and basically telling you what you will be questioned about.  Take his lab too it's really fun.

He is amazing! Pay attention to the blue words in his lectures. Those are the main topics. Some in-class exercise questions get recycled into the exams so pay attention! Fun to joke with but serious in wanting you to pass his class. He cares about his students and wants you to succeed. Take as many notes as possible. Office hours are encouraged!

Lab consists of a short intro on what your doing, walks through it step by step. Notebooks were to be completed in class; easy A on the notebook if you got everything down (he is very particular about your title). He'll make your question sound like it's the dumbest one yet, so ask around first. 1 group project + presentation fairly easy.
Dr. Hayes is really nice. He answers questions and gives lots of opportunities to make sure you understand the material. Homework is light and easy and tests are straight from the PowerPoints.
He is good, genetics is a lot but he is the GOAT of genetics lecture and lab. Put in effort

Great teacher. He will work with you on things. AMAZING for Genetics Lab. Good for lecture. He will help you understand his test structure after you take the first one. Remember the blue words! He is really funny and cool. Not bad looking either. You must come to class, because he does in class quizzes, and gives out the correct answers to class.
